result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin R. Hampton

defendant.name: Hampton, Dustin R.
defendant.address: 811 East Prairie Street, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt:
2:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Dustin R. Hampton appeared by phone.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun appeared by video for Dustin R. Hampton.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Dadoun is heard on the status of the case. Defendant pleads not guilty.  Clerk is directed to enter not guilty pleas into the record.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on January 5, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:02 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Dustin R. Hampton not in court.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun appeared by video for Dustin R. Hampton.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Dadoun is heard on defendants non appearance, reports that Defendant had been in an accident.  Requests to adjourn both cases.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:03 Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Dustin R. Hampton appeared by phone.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun appeared by video for Dustin R. Hampton.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court - 22CM51 is not on the calendar today, however we should address that case today also.  There is a warrant in that case
Comments by Atty. Dadoun
comments by Defendant, questions whether it is a crime to file a false police report
Court advises him to discuss it with his attorney

Court will allow def. to appear via zoom for initial appearance in 22CM51 
Def. states he is not sure where he going to be living, continue to use address and it will be forwarded
Atty. Steiner is agreeable to quashing the warrant

Court cancels warrant in 22CM51
 

Both cases will be continued to Oct. 3, 2022 - court will mail copy of complaint to def at last known
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:47 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Dustin R. Hampton appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun appeared by video for Dustin R. Hampton. 
     Atty. Dadoun comments.
     D.A. asks adjourn to next status date to have a chance to see what is to become of the new case.  
     Def. encouraged to reach out to Pub. Def. for the new case; mail to go to father's residence.  Atty. Doudon believes bond was modified to lift the contact with father.  D.A. amends bond to no violent or abusive contact with W.H.  Def. instructed to stop in at the Clerk's office to sign the amended bond.  Court grants request to modify bond as requested.  
     Court concludes at 1:53 p.m.
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:58 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Dustin R. Hampton appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun appeared by video for Dustin R. Hampton. 

Atty Dadoun is heard. Defendant plead not guilty. Clerk directed to enter plea into the record. 

Atty Dadoun is heard on the address/location of defendant. Def gave updated phone number to use.
Jury status hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:50 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Dustin R. Hampton in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

The public defender contact information was provided to the defendant. 

Warrant will be canceled and not authorized.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

9:36 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Dustin R. Hampton not in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

No appearance by defendant. 
Atty Steiner is heard. State requests a warrant. $150.00 bond out. Warrant to be held for a few days to see if counsel reaches out to reschedule.
Court orders a warrant, $150.00 bond out and will hold the warrant until tomorrow in case Atty Dadoun reaches out.

1:16 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Dustin R. Hampton not in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun appeared by video for Dustin R. Hampton. 
      Court to reschedule; believed that Def. is homeless.
      Wm. Hamptom states Def. will be back late this afternoon and wants to pick up his stuff at the house.  Court states bond conditions remain in place.  Hearing on June 1 on the injunction case.
     Atty. Dadoun requests contact info if any obtained.
     Court concludes at 1:19 p.m.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No contact with WH. No contact with the residence at 811 E Prairie Street with the exception that the Defendant can go to WH residence only with Law Enforcement in order to pick up some personal belongings. The defendant shall remain in jail custody until pickup arrangements have been made for transport to a treatment facility for his evaluation.

1:49 PM Call to Order by Court. Appearances stated: Defendant Dustin R. Hampton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard on bond modification. State recommends a $150.00 signature bond. No contact with WH. No contact with the residence at 811 E Prairie Street with the exception that the Defendant can go to WH residence only with Law Enforcement, in order to pick up some personal belongings. The defendant shall remain in jail custody until pickup arrangements have been made for transport to the treatment facility for his evaluation. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $150.00 signature bond. No contact with WH. No contact with the residence at 811 E Prairie Street with the exception that the Defendant can go to WH residence only with Law Enforcement in order to pick up some personal belongings. The defendant shall remain in jail custody until pickup arrangements have been made for transport to a treatment facility for his evaluation.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Julie Dadoun

9:31 AM Call to Order by Court. Appearances stated: Defendant Dustin R. Hampton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zaleski appeared by video for defendant.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Zaleski is heard on defendant retaining an attorney to cover both cases. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding. 
Defendant is heard. Requests a signature bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
State Public Defender's Office indicates that Mr. Hampton reached out them.  He DOES qualify for a SPD atty.
Hearing on May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:26 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Dustin R Hamptom appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $150.00 cash bond. No abusive or violent contact with WH. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $150.00 cash bond. No contact with WH and No contact with WH's residence at 811 E Prairie Street Prairie du Chien.  

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No contact with WH and No Contact with WH's residence at 811 E Prairie Street in Prairie du Chien.
